page.title: 01LANDSCAPE DESCRIPTION
page.content: There is a large amount of commercial coniferous woodland in this area eg Devon Wood and Drummy Wood. All of the woodland together would cover an area of around 4km. Minor roads cross the area. In square 0735 there is part of Clatto reservoir. There are also several small streams joining the reservoir . The land is mainly used for mixed farming. The maximum height is 248 m (Clatto hill). The main settlement types are farms e.g. Southfield, Fronthill,Rameldry and Kettlehill.The B938 crosses the area but in general the Clatto area is relatively inaccessible.A prehistoric fort can be found at reference 343072.
